verses.text: \add Is there\add* not an appointed time to man upon earth? \add Are not\add* his days also like the days of a hireling?
As a servant earnestly desireth the shadow, And as a hireling looketh for the reward of his work:
So am I made to possess months of vanity, And wearisome nights are appointed to me.
When I lie down, I say, When shall I arise, and the night be gone? And I am full \add of\add* tossings to and fro unto the dawning of the day.
My flesh is clothed with worms and clods of dust; My skin is broken, and become loathsome.
My days are swifter than a weaverâ€™s shuttle, And are spent without hope.
O remember that my life \add is\add* wind: Mine eye shall no more see good.
The eye of him that hath seen me shall see me no \add more:\add* Thine eyes \add are\add* upon me, and I \add am\add* not.
\add As\add* the cloud is consumed and vanisheth away: So he that goeth down \add to\add* the grave shall come up no \add more\add*.
He shall return no more to his house, Neither shall his place know him any more.
Therefore I will not refrain my mouth; I will speak in the anguish of my spirit; I will complain in the bitterness of my soul.
\add Am\add* I a sea, or a whale, That thou settest a watch over me?
When I say, My bed shall comfort me, My couch shall ease my complaint;
Then thou scarest me with dreams, And terrifiest me through visions:
So that my soul chooseth strangling, \add And\add* death rather than my life.
I loathe \add it;\add* I would not live alway: Let me alone; for my days \add are\add* vanity.
What \add is\add* man, that thou shouldest magnify him? And that thou shouldest set thine heart upon him?
And \add that\add* thou shouldest visit him every morning, \add And\add* try him every moment?
How long wilt thou not depart from me, Nor let me alone till I swallow down my spittle?
I have sinned; what shall I do unto thee, O thou preserver of men? Why hast thou set me as a mark against thee, So that I am a burden to myself?
And why dost thou not pardon my transgression, And take away mine iniquity? For now shall I sleep in the dust; And thou shalt seek me in the morning, but I \add shall\add* not \add be\add*.
